Dictionary.Name: The Collaborative International Dictionary of English v.0.44

Definition.WordDefinition:
Sandal \San"dal\, n. Same as {Sendal}. [1913 Webster]
Sails of silk and ropes of sandal. --Longfellow. [1913 Webster]

Dictionary.Name: The Collaborative International Dictionary of English v.0.44

Definition.WordDefinition: Sandal \San"dal\, n. Sandalwood. ``Fans of sandal.'' --Tennyson. [1913 Webster]

Dictionary.Name: The Collaborative International Dictionary of English v.0.44

Definition.WordDefinition: Sandal \San"dal\, n. [F. sandale, L. sandalium, Gr. ?, dim. of ?, probably from Per. sandal.] (a) A kind of shoe consisting of a sole strapped to the foot; a protection for the foot, covering its lower surface, but not its upper. (b) A kind of slipper. (c) An overshoe with parallel openings across the instep. [1913 Webster]
sandal n : a shoe consisting of a sole fastened by straps to the foot
